result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin J. Wrobel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Justin Wrobebel in court with Attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, addresses Atty Schaefer's motion to withdraw as atty of record.  Court would like to hear from defendant as to whether he's objecting to Atty Schaefer's motion. Atty Schaefer indicates she would like her name taken any case associated with Mr. Wrobel to avoid any confusion. Court will address the issue when Atty Korb comes down with the file.  Atty Korb now present in court. Court questions defendant on Atty Schaefer's motion to withdraw. Defendant has no objection to Atty Schaefer withdrawing from the case. State concerned that case is a year and a half old but indicates  this case is in the #2 postion for trial and probably won't be proceeding on 11/30/16. Court grants Atty Schaefer's motion to withdraw, signs order.  Atty Schaefer will contact the PD office to get new counsel appointed for Mr. Wrobel. Court removes trial from the calendar, advises defendant to communicate with PD office to get new counsel in place. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Pre-trial conference on November 14, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Jury trial on November 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.

No violent contact with C.G.  Can go to residence to pick up son and personal property only. Not to be there or extended periods of time.

Defendant Justin J. Wrobel in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Schaefer has received the files from prior counsel and has received an offer from the State, needs more time to review discovery and State's offer with defendant. State has no objection to a brief adjournment. Victim C.G on the phone, asks court to lift the no contact with her residence. State strongly objects to defendant having contact with the residence, bond was already modified to no violent contact with C.G. Court revises bond.  Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 09:30 am.
